meanings.definition: A segment of an arthropod limb.
meanings.sent1: The podomere of the insect's leg helps it move.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the podomere of the crab's claw.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten pounced on the podomere of the spider's leg.
meanings.sent4: The podomere of the centipede's leg was like a tiny puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The shiny podomere of the beetle's leg caught my eye.

meanings.definition: One of the units that make up a segmented appendage in certain animals.
meanings.sent1: Each podomere of the millipede's leg is connected to the next.
meanings.sent2: The biologist counted the podomeres of the caterpillar's antenna.
meanings.sent3: The curious child pretended the podomere of the worm's body was a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: The podomere of the scorpion's tail was like a small building block.
meanings.sent5: The delicate podomere of the shrimp's appendage was fascinating to observe.
